creator: J.Gao@isu.usyd.edu.au
text:
httpd-2.0.48> more ./runconf

CC=gcc CFLAGS="-Wall -O3" LDFLAGS="-L/usr/local/lib -R/usr/local/lib
-L/usr/local/BerkeleyDB.4.1/lib -R/usr/local/BerkeleyDB.4.1/lib
" \
    ./configure --enable-maintainer-mode \
    --prefix="/usr/local/apache_2.0.47" \
    --enable-mime-magic \
    --enable-headers \
    --enable-unique-id \
    --enable-dav \
    --enable-info \
    --enable-rewrite \
    --enable-so \
    --enable-proxy \
    --enable-proxy-http \
    --with-mpm=worker \
    --with-berkeley-db=/usr/local/BerkeleyDB.4.1 \
    --enable-modules=most \
    --enable-mods-shared=max

So the same environment, but different result.

creator: J.Gao@isu.usyd.edu.au
text:
Setting LD_LIBRARY_PATH solved the problem. But this behaviour is different 
from 2.0.47.

the same problem comes, when doing the following:

./configure --prefix=/usr/local --enable-so --enable-dav --enable-deflate --
enable-ssl --with-ssl=/usr/local --with-dbm=db4 --with-berkeley-
db=/usr/local/db40

it is configures job to set this like this. otherwise configure/autoconf would 
not do its job, and you would not use it.
creator: soloturn99@yahoo.com
mads@apache.org
text: *** Bug 25233 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text: This is a feature not a bug: the new autoconf code is correct, and more flexible.
